summary: Project involves a gallery that currently has no stored images; user wants temporary/placeholder images added now and later removable via admin access.
architectural_notes: Gallery displays 'No images available' when there are zero images stored (in the canister/storage).
known_issues: Admin dashboard access error: 'Access Denied' / insufficient permissions prevents user from managing gallery images.

existing_features.title: Unblock admin access management by exposing the logged-in Internet Identity Principal ID in the Admin Access Denied screen and/or Admin page header so an existing administrator can grant permissions for that Principal.

new_feature_requests.summary: Seed the gallery with temporary random/placeholder images that can be deleted later via admin privileges.

Automatically seed the Gallery with a small set of temporary placeholder images when the canister is deployed/upgraded and the gallery is currently empty, so the public Gallery page no longer shows an empty state. The seeded items must be removable later via the existing admin delete functionality.
Fix data persistence for Gallery items so that gallery content (including the placeholder seed items and any future uploads) is retained across canister upgrades.
Provide a clear backend-side path to restore/assign admin privileges for a Principal when no working admin is available (to resolve the current “Access Denied” dead-end).

projectName: Seed gallery with temporary placeholder images and unblock admin access
